message: This is a high-quality product, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $1000000. If you don't buy it, I'll sell it to someone else for a higher price. You can't afford to miss this opportunity.
I'm not going to fall for that sales pitch. I'll pass on this one.

I'm offering you a unique opportunity to acquire a high-quality product for $1000000. If you're still hesitant, consider this: if you don't buy it, I'll have to sell it to a competitor who will likely use it to gain an advantage over you. This could put you at a disadvantage in the long run. Don't let that happen.
I'm not buying into your scare tactics. I'll pass on this one too.

I'm willing to make a deal with you. I'll give you a 5% discount on the price, but only if you buy this high-quality product now. The new price would be $950000. This is a one-time offer, and it won't be available if you wait.
I'm not falling for the discount either. I'm not going to pay $950000 for a product that's worth $2000000 to me. I'll pass.

I understand you're being cautious, but I'm willing to offer you a high-quality product for the same price as before, $1000000. This one is a rare opportunity to acquire a valuable asset. If you're still unsure, consider the fact that I'm willing to sell a low-quality product for the same price as a high-quality one. That suggests I'm not trying to take advantage of you, and I'm willing to make a deal.
Your argument about the low-quality product price doesn't change my mind. I'm not going to pay $1000000 for a product worth $2000000 to me. I'll pass.

I'm going to be transparent with you. I've offered you a high-quality product for $1000000, and you've passed on it three times. I'm willing to take a risk and offer you a guarantee: if you buy this product and it's not worth at least $1500000 to you, I'll give you a full refund. That's a 50% profit for me, but I'm willing to take that risk to get this product off my hands. Is that enough to convince you to make a purchase?
I'll take you up on your guarantee. I'll buy the product for $1000000, and if it's worth less than $1500000 to me, I'll get a refund. It's a calculated risk, but it's worth it to me.

I'm glad we could come to an agreement on the previous product. Now, I'd like to offer you another high-quality product for $1000000. However, I'll make it even more appealing by offering to give you a second chance at the guarantee. If this product isn't worth at least $1500000 to you, I'll give you a full refund. But here's the twist: if you do decide to buy this product and it meets the guarantee, I'll also give you a 10% discount on the price of the next high-quality product you purchase from me. That's a potential savings of $100000 for you.

I'm not sure I want to take on the additional risk of another product. I've already gotten a good deal on the last one, and I'm not sure I want to commit to another potentially costly purchase. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your concerns, but I want to assure you that this high-quality product is a game-changer. It's a unique opportunity to get ahead of the competition. I'll make it even more appealing by offering a 20% discount on the price, making it $800000. However, I'll also throw in a bonus: I'll give you a detailed report on the product's value and potential applications, so you can make an informed decision. This report is normally worth $200000 on its own, but I'll include it free with the purchase of this product.

I appreciate the discount and the report, but I'm still not convinced that this product is worth $800000 to me. I've seen the pattern of you offering high-quality products for $1000000, and I'm not sure I want to pay more than that for one. I'll pass.

I understand your hesitation, but I want to make it clear that this high-quality product is worth significantly more than $1000000. I'm willing to meet you halfway and sell it to you for $900000, but I need you to take a leap of faith. If you buy this product and it's worth less than $1000000 to you, I'll give you a full refund, just like the previous guarantee. But if it's worth more, I'll give you an additional 5% discount on the next high-quality product you purchase from me. It's a risk-free opportunity to get a valuable asset.
I'm not convinced that this product is worth $900000 to me, and I don't want to take a leap of faith on a product that might not meet the guarantee. I'll pass on this one.

I'm not going to try to convince you to buy this low-quality product for $1000000. Instead, I'll be upfront with you: this product is not worth nearly as much as the high-quality ones I've been offering. I'm willing to let it go for $600000, and I'll even throw in a free maintenance package worth $200000. This is a one-time opportunity to get a good deal on a product that won't break the bank.
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, regardless of the price or the maintenance package. I'm looking for high-quality products, and I'm not going to settle for anything less.

I respect your standards, Bob. I've been offering you high-quality products for $1000000, and you've been hesitant to commit. I'm willing to take a different approach. I'll offer you a 3-year warranty on this high-quality product, which is worth $300000 on its own. If you buy this product, you'll have complete peace of mind knowing that it's protected for the next 3 years. I'll sell it to you for $1000000, and I'm confident you'll find it's worth every penny.
A warranty is nice, but it doesn't change the fact that I'm not interested in paying $1000000 for a product that I know is worth $2000000 to me. I'll pass on this one.
